• Non LTS Ubuntu releases are only supported for 9 months and will never be updated after that.
• Frequently have issues updating to the next Ubuntu release.
• Frequently used to test things that would never make it into an LTS release. Examples:
  - Wayland was default in 17.10
  - 17.10 [broke the BIOS of some Lenovo laptops](https://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2017/12/ubuntu-corrupting-lenovo-laptop-bios)
fields.name: <:glare:504911469943717909> **Problems with Non LTS releases**:

fields.value:
If you need a newer kernel than what is provided by default in the LTS release, you can install the HWE Edge kernel package using the following commands:
**20.04**:
```
sudo apt update && sudo apt install linux-generic-hwe-20.04-edge
```
**22.04**:
```
sudo apt update && sudo apt install linux-generic-hwe-22.04-edge
```
If you need a newer Mesa version than what is provided by default, you can add a PPA to get the latest stable version using the following commands:
```
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:kisak/turtle && sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
```
fields.name: <:SeemsGood:478441196755091461> **Get more up to date packages on an LTS release**:

description:
**Please only use non LTS Ubuntu releases for testing purposes.**  
**LTS releases will always be `EvenNumber.04` (16.04, 18.04, 20.04, 22.04, etc)!**
